main event: A pulsating light appeared to be standing still in the distant horizon on July 10, 1957, near Del Rio, Texas.
interesting points: The object was observed for 45 minutes and did not move, resembling a bright star initially., The sighting occurred under clear skies with moonlight and starlight., The object disappeared over the horizon after being stationary., The sighting was consistent over several nights., The report suggests it could have been an aircraft or possibly astronomical but remains inconclusive.
witness description: No specific witness details provided, only a report of the observation.
